address: 70 Am Wriezener Bahnhof; Friedrichshain; 10243 Berlin; Germany
name: Berghain | Panorama Bar | Säule
description: Sitting in a dusty lot on the border of Kreuzberg and Friedrichshain, Berghain is widely considered one of the world's best nightclubs. It has three dance floors: Berghain, a dark main room where most DJs play techno, Panorama Bar, an upstairs space that's more focused on house, and the Säule on ground floor, though the music policy in all rooms is very open-ended. (There's also a men's-only club on the first level called Lab.Oratory, the occasionally used Halle and a smaller club with a separate entrance called Kantine am Berghain.) A number of details give Berghain its cult appeal: its residents, which include Steffi, Tama Sumo, Marcel Dettmann and Ben Klock, its set lengths, which range from three hours to more than eight, and its decor, which is mostly metal and poured concrete, with 30 meter ceilings and seemingly endless nooks and crannies. Most of the parties are extremely long: Friday night events usually wrap up early Saturday afternoon, but Saturdays typically run well into Monday morning. Perhaps the most notorious aspect of the club is its door policy—hundreds of people are turned away each weekend, including regulars, often for reasons that are completely mysterious to everyone except the doormen. The club also runs the Ostgut Ton record label and a booking agency.

name: Watergate
description: Watergate is a split-level, two-room club overlooking the River Spree in Berlin's Kreuzberg neighbourhood. Located on the river's edge with floor-to-ceiling glass windows, it offers a panoramic view of the Spree with curtains that can let the daylight in as the club night winds down. Known for its LED lighting panel that spans the entire length of the top floor of the club, Watergate mostly plays host to house and techno parties. In 2008, it started a record label: Watergate Records.

name: Tresor / Globus
description: The new incarnation of an old techno institution, Tresor Club is set in an abandoned power plant spanning 22,000m² on Köpenicker Straße in Berlin's Mitte neighbourhood - a labyrinth of concrete passages mazing into basement vaults and industrial halls. Inside there are three separate but connected floors: Globus and +4Bar for house and experimental electronic music, and, of course, the famed vault which, reached through a 30m long tunnel, carries the Tresor sound uncompromisingly. The club is open every Monday, Wednesday, Friday, and Saturday.

name: ://about blank
description:
://about blank is a formerly illegal, multi-room club by Ostrkeuz S-Bahnhof in Friedrichshain. It's a short walk from Salon Zur Wilde Renate, and like that club, it's a lightly renovated re-purposed building with seemingly endless nooks and crannies. There are two main dance floors inside, and in the summer DJs play out in the garden (this is open in the winter too, often with a bonfire going). 

The music policy is open-ended but mostly focused on house and techno, with occasional bass or disco nights. The overall atmosphere is gritty, and the parties often go well into the following afternoon or evening.

name: Club der Visionaere
description:
Club der Visionaere is a rustic and understated spot between Kreuzberg and Treptower Park. It sits on a canal in a small brick building, with offices upstairs and a dance floor downstairs. In a way it's more of a bar or afterhours venue than a nightclub: entry is usually five euro or less (sometimes free), the dance floor holds fewer than 50 people, and the sound system, though clear, is very quiet. Most attendees spend their time standing on the wooden deck outside, or sitting beneath the weeping willow that hangs over part of the club. Most of the venue is down by the canal, but there's also a second space up at street level where a pizzeria is open most nights in the summer. 

Club der Visionaere has a laidback booking policy: the lineup is often decided a week or two in advance, and unplanned DJ sets are common. Opening hours depend on the weather and level of attendance, but on big weekends it can run from Friday through Monday without a break.

name: Renate
description:
Born from an unrenovated apartment building in Friedrichshain, across the river from Treptower Park. 

Salon Zur Wilden Renate has three main dance floors: Schwarzer Raum on the ground floor, mainly focussing on techno. Then upstairs there is Grüner Raum where it’s all about house, and Roter Raum for all things slow, weird and trippy disco. The atmosphere is that of a theatrical house party. The booking is a mixture of international and local artists. A large outdoor courtyard is open during the summer, which provides another bar with food and plenty of space to hang out.

name: Ritter Butzke
description: Ritter Butzke is located on the ground floor of a former factory in Kreuzberg. It began as an illegal club in 2007, but went official two years later. The venue has three main dance floors, plus an outdoor courtyard that's open in the summer. Musically the main focus is House & Techno. The DJs and the crowd are most often Berliners. The club has a big cast of residents and regulars that has included Niconé, Matthias Schuell and Prismode & Solvane.

name: Kater Blau
description: Kater Blau is the new club on the holzmarkt area, which is situated on the old area from bar25 and bar24.

name: Suicide Club
description:
The Suicide Club (fka Suicide Circus) is one of the most traditional and established techno clubs in Berlin, with a large dance floor in the centre, an open-air floor, cutting-edge electronic music and a cosy outdoor terrace/beer garden.

The club has everything you need for a perfect techno night: reduced exterior, dark corners, fog machine, industrial-style dance floor, mystical lighting and a fat sound system.

The name of the club "Suicide" refers to the band "Suicide", which paved the way for later minimal techno back in the 70s with synthesizers and drum computers.
vicinity: Warschauer Brücke, Revaler Straße 99 Zugang über, Berlin

name: Golden Gate
description: Nestled beneath the Jannowitzbrücke train stop, Golden Gate is one of Berlin's grittiest clubs. The interior is small, dark and mostly free of decoration. It's known for having exceptionally long operating hours, even for Berlin—most weeks there's one party on Thursday night that finishes on Friday afternoon, then a second one that starts on Friday at midnight and lasts until Monday morning. The club consists of one main dance floor, a small sitting area, a bathroom section upstairs and a small garden in the summer. The music is mostly up-front tech house, usually by Berlin-based DJs.

name: :Vorwien
description: Dubtechnosound in the Basement

name: 8MM
description: Serving Berlin's underground music scene since 2002.

name: Acud Macht NEU
description:
Acud Macht Neu
http://acudmachtneu.de/

name: ÆDEN
description:
ÆDEN - A modern Lustgarten of elysian charm.
Located on the Lohmühleninsel in the cultural heart of Kreuzberg.
Live music, art and performance on two indoor floors, with an outdoor floor in the summer.

name: Arena Club
description: Located on the River Spree behind several warehouses at the edge of Treptow in Berlin, arenaclub is the smaller club venue located behind the bigger Arena Berlin. With a dance floor flanked by two bars, arenaclub offers a close, intimate experience perfect for pounding techno with a small balcony lounge area for seating and a clear view of the rest of the club and revellers below.

address: Lychener Strasse 60; Prenzlauer Berg; 10437 Berlin; Germany
name: Ausland
AVA Club
description: Calling itself "a retreat for those who want the Berlin club scene to be a place without hype and excessive door policies," AVA Club is a small spot by Warschauer Platz with mostly local DJs playing house and techno. Though a range of different parties take place at the club, each week is punctuated by two residencies: Techno Mittwoch on Wednesdays and Hot Box, a queer party for "any and all genders" on Friday nights.

name: Babylon Kino
description: Kino Babylon is a cinema/venue hybrid.

name: Backsteinboot
description: Off location situated on the top floor of a warehouse on an island in Berlin, with a panoramic view, hosting various music & art related events.

name: Badehaus Berlin
description:
Badehaus Berlin is a concert and party venue in the RAW-Area in Friedrichshain with two dance floors, an extra bar area and a summer-terrace. All together it can welcome up to 400 people. The programme is really open to nearly every genre and it has hosted diverse upcoming live acts.
Every Tuesday night they’re hosting the legendary Swag Jam, a hip hop jam session led by a full band.
vicinity: Revaler Strasse 99, (auf dem RAW-Gelände, Zugang Höhe Simon-Dach-Str.), Berlin

name: Baergarten at Revier Südost
description:
Kunst- und Kulturbiergarten
Genieß kalte Getränke und heiße Pizza - in der Sonne oder an einem schattigen Plätzchen, zu entspannten und rauen Tönen.

name: Barbox by Generator
description: Contemporary designed Bar, a thoughtful crafted menu with first-class Cocktails and a lineup of Resident DJ's keeping the party going. Whatever your vibe is, snug velvet sofas make it a great place to lounge with your friends.

name: Beate Uwe
description:
The Logo bu stands for Beate Uwe and also for the wish: be urself!
 
DJs, promoters and guests admire the technical precise soundsystem and warm output in Beate Uwe, as well as the atmosphere and the caring staff.
Small and familiar but always different Beate Uwe gives all kind of events space to be creative.
 
Close to Golden Gate, Kater Blau, Ohm & Tresor Beate Uwe is placed just in the heart of Berlin. Well hidden in between former GDR „Plattenbauten“ Beate Uwe is located near to the trainstations Jannowitzbrücke and Alexanderplatz.
 
All Genders, all colours are welcome.

name: Bierpinsel
description:
"Seit Jahren schläft mitten in Berlin ein Riese, die Farbe verblasst und die einzigartige Architektur verschwindet langsam im tristen Stadtbild. 2010 wird das Wahrzeichen wachgeküsst! 
Der Riese bringt eine besondere Herausforderung mit sich: Er ist 46 Meter hoch, von bislang roter Farbe und ein Symbol der futuristisch anmutenden Architektur der 1970er Jahre. Gebaut wurde der Turm mit dem aufgesetzten Mehreck (plus Treppenturm) zwischen 1972 und 1976 nach Plänen der Architekten Ralph Schüler und Ursulina Schüler-Witte, die auch das bekannte ICC entwarfen. Seither wird das Gebäude immer wieder von Architekten aus der ganzen Welt studiert."

name: Birgit
description:
In the very heart of Berlin's most colorful quarter, lies Birgit: a huge, magical playground for adults.

Our Birgit reigns over three magnificent dance floors equipped with powerful Funktion One systems. Each floor is designed for a completely different musical style: Birgit's Wohnzimmer is a half open cosy living room for Berlin's finest Deep and Tech House. The Bunker floor is a powerful, hypnotizing Techno vault, and the Rummel floor is a fun floor where everything but electronic music is being played.
Whether you are there to enjoy a cold, fresh keg beer or to lose yourself in Birgit's full weekend party program, Birgit is exactly the venue that offers you the best of everything you ever loved in the night.

name: Boat - MS Lex / Boat Terminal: Mercedes-Benz Arena
description: Boat Terminal

name: Bohnengold
description: Bohnengold is a popular bar in Kreuzberg. A large, multi-roomed space with plenty of seating, it usually gets busy on the weekends. The venue's music—usually house, techno or disco—is delivered through an assortment of speakers dotted around its interior. There's a small dance floor in action most Friday and Saturday nights, which, by midnight, is usually bursting at the seams.

name: Bulbul Berlin
description: Bulbul Berlin (formerly known as Farbfernseher) is a dance club & bar in Kreuzberg since 2019. The venue offers a selection of electronic music with local and international artists.

name: Callie's
description:
Callie’s is a non-profit experimental institution founded for the purpose of fostering creativity, cultural exchange, and cross-disciplinary collaboration.

Through residencies, exhibitions, and public programs, we strive to support local and international artists while becoming a resource for our immediate community.

Callie’s operates in the spirit of inquiry; our activities are a form of research aimed at developing new models of social and artistic engagement.

name: C-Base
description: 1995 wurden unter Berlin-Mitte die Überreste einer 4,5 Milliarden Jahre alten Raumstation entdeckt. Erste Forschungen ergaben, daß sich die c-förmige Raumstation mit ihrem Mittelpunkt unter dem heutigen Alexanderplatz befinden muß und aus 7 Ringen besteht.

name: Chausseestrasse 131
description: Intimate vibe in the heart of the city, great drinks and music selection. Weekly hosting various international and local acts.

name: Christa Kupfer
description: Christa Kupfer, located in the heart of Kreuzberg, provides the perfect backdrop to ring in the night alongside two rooms of funk, disco & techno.

name: Club OST
description: Club OST, nestled between Osthafen and Ostkreuz, consciously focuses on musical gems with warm sounds from Berlin and the celestial planes.

name: Crack Bellmer
description:
A little utopia since 2011 🌈
Fr+Sat from 8 ——-

name: Dark Matter Berlin
description:
DARK MATTER - A multidimensional parallel world of light, space and sound. 

DARK MATTER is a parallel cosmos of expansive light installations in which the boundaries between the real and the digital worlds become blurred. Within the pitch-black rooms of a converted factory, the visitor embarks on a journey through seven partly interactive works. Light, movement and sound fuse into emotional choreographies of luminous shapes and colors.



Arriving by Public Transport. 

Tram: 21 (Gustav-Holzmann-Str.)
Bus: 194, 240, N94  (Rummelsburg) + 13 minutes on foot
S-Bahn: S3 (Rummelsburg) + 13 minutes on foot
​
Berlin Ostkreuz:
S-Bahn: S3, S5, S7, S8, S9, S41, S42, S75, S85
Bahn: EC, IC, IRE, RB12, RB14, RB24-26, RE1, RE2, RE7
+ 25 minutes on foot
​

BY BIKE
There is a cycle route along the beautiful Spree.

BY CAR
DARK MATTER does not offer parking. There is limited public parking nearby. Parking is free of charge.

name: Deus Temple Berlin
description: The Deus Temple Berlin is an event space with multiple areas. It hosts a  big beergarden that will also be used for large events, a cocktail bar, a restaurant and a big terrace. Right next door, the first wave pool of the city "Wellenwerk" houses the largest indoor surf wave on the planet.

name: EWerk
description:
E-werk originally closed in 1997 and opened only sparodically in 2004-5. It has been used in 2009-2010 for large one off parties. 

It's located on Mauerstrasse near Wilhelmstrasse.

name: FEZ Berlin
description: Das FEZ-Berlin ist Europas größtes gemeinnütziges Kinder-, Jugend- und Familienzentrum. Es bietet kreatives Spiel, Spaß und Erholung und vereint in seinem Ferienprogramm Bildung, Erlebnis und Kultur. Einzigartig sind die inhaltlichen Angebote zu den Schwerpunkten Globales Lernen und Bildung zur Nachhaltigen Entwicklung, Europa- und Internationale Bildung sowie kulturelle Bildung. 200.000 m² Outdoor- und 13.000 m² Indoor-Nutzfläche machen das FEZ -Berlin zum idealen Ort für eine Vielzahl von Veranstaltungen.

name: Forum Factory
Funkhaus Berlin
description:
Funkhaus is a former GDR broadcast centre built in the 1950s, located overlooking the River Spree in Berlin's east. The product of joint efforts by architects and acousticians to create a world-class broadcasting campus, the multi-purpose venue houses spaces dedicated to recording symphony orchestras, choirs, chamber and jazz ensembles, pop music and radio plays.

Funkhaus regularly hosts large-scale club events, live performances and installations. The venue also houses MONOM, an experimental performance venue and spatial sound studio. MONOM comes equipped with a high-spec 4DSOUND system, a spatial instrument that enables a physical and interactive sound environment.

name: Funkloch Berlin
description: FUNKLOCH is a charming retro bar in Neukölln hosting different kinds of events within the week and on the weekend. Besides the bar and main area, it features a hidden basement with cozy chillout opportunities.

name: gART.n
description: Ein Stück Kultur, ein Stück Natur, ein Freiraum in der Stadt.

name: Gestrandet An Der Jannowitzbrücke
description: Gestrandet Bar an der Jannowitzbrücke

name: Gretchen
description: Gretchen's programming covers electronica, electro, trap, house, bass, dubstep, drum'n'bass, experimental, avantgarde, funk and hip hop - mostly on two floors. The club is located in Berlin-Kreuzberg. The building features a vaulted ceiling on columns. An outdoor courtyard is open during summer.

name: H13 Kulturpark
description: We are a young association from Berlin and stand for the promotion of young, urban culture. We founded the non-profit association “Neue urbane Welten e.V.” in 2017. In our work we want to create places and experiences for society that bring people closer to the possibilities of urban life. In May 2019 our music group took over the project H13, an 18.000m2 area for the use as Free-Open-Air Space, Urban Garden, Open-Air Gallery and cultural meeting place. We are happy about every interested approach that enriches the H13!

name: Halle
description: The "unused" other half of Berghain. Which will be used for concerts, exhibitions and other events.

name: Haselhorst 13
description: Soli Party h13

name: Haus Der Kulturen Der Welt
description: The House of World Cultures is an art institution presenting exhibitions, theater and dance performances, concerts, author readings, films and congresses on non-European art and culture.

name: Hempgalore
description: CBD shop that hosts events on regular basis

name: Hoppetosse
description: Hoppetosse is the on-water sister venue to the well-known Club der Visionäre. It's a permanently docked boat (dubbed MS Hoppetosse), located on the Spree not far from Arena Club. There's usually one dance floor—surrounded by crystal-clear Morf speakers from Mo Stern—in action at parties, which usually take place on the weekends. Like its smaller neighbour, Hoppetosse's booking policy focusses on minimalist house and techno, delivered by a combination of local favourites and a rotating cast of the style's key names.

name: HÖR Berlin
description: Video/Radio Broadcast Series

name: House of Gin
description:
STAY GOLD! - 150 verschiedene Gins, zum Teil aus limitierten Abfüllungen, warten darauf, von euch entdeckt zu werden! Wahre Gin-Liebhaber können natürlich auch ein ganzes Tasting-Menü wählen und so auf eine persönliche Gin-Weltreise gehen.

Für den Hunger zwischendurch bieten wir Snacks aus unserem Restaurant beef 45 an - dazu gibt es elektronische Beats.

name: Icon
description: Small basement venue in Prenzlauerberg. Sound: Drum'n Bass, Breakbeat, HipHop, elecktro & funk.

name: Industriepalast Hostel
description: Open Air Fläche mitten in Berlin

name: It's a Bar
description: It's a bar in your living room.

address: 70 Am Wriezener Bahnhof; Friedrichshain; 10243 Berlin; Germany
name: Kantine am Berghain
description: The Kantine is located in a small building next to the Berghain/Panorama Bar.

name: Kesselhaus
description: Askanische Strasse 185

name: KitKatClub
description: Located just around the corner from Tresor, KitKatClub is a popular co-ed fetish spot. Sex is allowed (or encouraged), and on most nights you'll have to strip to get in. But the music is by no means an afterthought. The weekly programme is notably diverse, with regular nights that run the gamut from house to breaks to psytrance, mostly played by local DJs.

name: Kitty Cheng Bar
description: Die Szenebar glänzt mit innovativen Cocktails, prominenten Gästen und einem Ambiente-Mix aus Barock und Trash.

name: KM28
description: KM28 is a volunteer-run venue for new and experimental music.

name: Komische Oper Berlin
description:
The Komische Oper Berlin is a German opera company based in Berlin. The company produces opera, operetta and musicals.

The opera house is located on Behrenstraße, just a few steps from Unter den Linden. Since 2004, the Komische Oper Berlin, along with the Berlin State Opera, the Deutsche Oper Berlin, the Berlin State Ballet, and the Bühnenservice Berlin (Stage and Costume Design), has been a member of the Berlin Opera Foundation.

name: Kreuzberg, Berlin
description: Kreuzberg, is a district of Berlin, Germany. It is part of the Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg borough located south of Mitte.

address: Schönhauser Allee 36-39; Prenzlauer Berg; 10435 Berlin; Germany
name: Kulturbrauerei
Kwia
description:
Listening Bar | Cafe | Gallery
Connect with sound, light and art in a queer space for modern Rituals✨Ambient focused dimension💗

name: Life Berlin
description: japanese robatayaki restaurant

name: MaHalla
description: Kulturzentrum in Berlin-Oberschöneweide

name: Malzfabrik
description: Alte Industrieanlage

name: Marktlokal Klub
description: Rave / D!sko / Klub in the basement of Markthalle IX right below Marktlokal (Restaurant,Bar & Klub)

name: Max-Schmeling-Halle
description:
Kapazitäten der Arena
Kapazität mit Mittelbühne, unbestuhlt: ca. 11.900 Personen
Festinstallierte Sitzplätze: 7.491
Plätze im Innenraum: 4.040
Imbiss-Stände in den Umläufen: 20
Rollstuhlplätze: mindestens 16
Behindertengerechte WCs: 8 in der Haupthalle, 7 in den Nebenbereichen

name: M-Bia
description:
Location:
M-BIA Club Berlin
Dircksenstr. 123
10178 Berlin

name: Mein Haus Am See
description: Mein Haus Am See is a bar with unique design, retro 70s and 80s original furniture and interior fittings with artwork on the raw walls, a large mirrored grandstand adds to the ambience, a place to chill, party and just enjoy.

name: Melitta Sundström
description: Cafe/Bar.

name: Mensch Meier
description: Situated in an industrial area on the border of Lichtenberg and Prenzlauer Berg, Mensch Meier is run by a team affiliated with the well-known Fusion Festival. They mainly hosts free parties featuring Berlin-based DJs, with a music policy centred on techno and house.

name: Metropol
description: Das Metropol, auch als Theater am Nollendorfplatz, Neues Schauspielhaus und Goya bekannte ehemalige Theater, ist neben dem Hochbahnhof der U-Bahn das markanteste Gebäude am Nollendorfplatz 5 im Berliner Ortsteil Schöneberg.

name: Minimal Bar
description: Contorted corridors guide you through the five rooms of Mini.mal Elektrokneipe. With its painted walls, table-tennis playground and daily DJ line-up, Mini* loves to keep you awake the whole night. On one main floor during the week and two floors on the weekend mostly berlin-based artists help you to get lost in time with minimal and deep house tunes. Located in the northern quarter of Friedrichshain close to S–Frankfurter Allee and U–Samariterstrasse. Open daily from 7pm. Free entry. Entrance is for 21+ only.

address: Stadtbahnbogen 159/160, 10178 Berlin-Mitte, im James Simon Park
name: Mokka Mitte Bar / James Simon Park
description: Bar located in Berlin Mitte, with a big open air area perfect for summer drinks.

name: Monarch
description: Bar looking over Kottbusser Tor.

name: MONOM
description: MONOM is an experimental performance venue and spatial sound studio. MONOM comes equipped with a high-spec 4DSOUND system, a spatial instrument that enables a physical and interactive sound environment.

name: Monster Ronson's Ichiban Karaoke
description: Karaoke bar.

name: Motif Wein
description: Natural wine shop in Berlin. We are a home for music too.

name: Napoleon Komplex
description:
Auf dem ehemaligen Deutsche Bahn Gelände und den dazugehörigen Werkstatthallen, können Besucher:innen und Gäste auf über 5000qm in großzügigen Innen- und Außenbereichen, mit entsprechendem Abstand, in eine völlig neue Welt eintauchen, um bei verschiedenen Veranstaltungen gemeinsame Momente zu teilen oder bei zahlreichen Workshops und Kunstprojekten selbst Teil des Projekts zu werden.


Dabei lautet die klare Devise: Keine Angst vor dem weißen Blatt Papier! Das Risiko eingehen - wie es einst der sinnbildliche Namensgeber Napoleon Bonaparte tat. Dabei Neues zu erschaffen und sich als Berliner Künstler:in seinen Platz in einer internationalen und avantgardistischen Kunstszene, selbst auch als Newcomer:in, zu finden. Eine gute Portion Größenwahn in der Kunst steht dem neuen Ost-Berlin ganz gut. Ob hier geboren oder zugezogen. Hauptsache Hier und Jetzt.

name: OHM
description: Club located in the former battery room of a disused power plant. Formerly known as Shift.

name: Old CCCP
description: Bar

name: Orville's Berlin
description: Cafè, Lunch & Aperitivo Bar im Tempelhofer Flughafen

name: ORWO Haus
description:
prefabricated house from the GDR era

Das ORWOhaus im Berliner Ortsteil Marzahn ist ein siebengeschossiges ehemaliges Industriegebäude. Es wurde in den 1970er Jahren erbaut und diente bis zur politischen Wende 1989 als Produktionsstätte des Filmherstellers ORWO.

name: Ost Hafen Berlin
description:
Industrie – Schick mit Panoramablick
Direkt an der Spree entsteht die neue Eventlocation Berlins.

name: OXI
description: club

name: Oyoun
description:
Oyoun is an anti-disciplinary cultural centre in Berlin-Neukölln. 
We initiate, conceive and realize artistic-cultural projects with migrant, decolonial and queer*feminist perspectives. 

As an intersectional platform, we have made it our mission to create an accessible and ambitious space that enables dialogue between local, national and international issues on an artistic level.

name: Paloma
description: www.palomabar.de/

name: Parkbühne Wuhlheide
description: The Wuhlheide is a cultural heritage site in Berlin, Germany, which serves as an open-air performance venue in the shape of an amphitheatre.

name: Prince Charles
description: Prince Charles is located at Aufbau Haus in Berlin Kreuzberg – or to be more precise: in the premises of Bechstein’s former employee swimming pool. Whether electronic nights, hip hop or crew love parties: the symbiosis of bar and club is the ideal setting for the hand-picked line up and fits perfectly to the creative hub around Aufbau Haus. Concerts and club nights in good company and cool atmosphere – that’s Prince Charles. And for those who go for a drink in the open: have a drink in the courtyard and enjoy the nice view of Kreuzberg’s sky.

name: Privatclub
description: A small, intimate club with a changing musical program, parties and concerts. Entrance via restaurant markthalle.

name: The Reed
description: JR

name: Richtershorn am See
description: Berlins schönste Open Air Location direkt am Wasser.

name: Roderich
description:
Beneath our branches and glimmering lights, Our darkest secrets and endless nights'
Roderich is an event space tucked away in Pankow, It hosts a very impressive fairy tale Garden for outdoor movie screenings,cultural events and Art installations.as well as 2 floors inside for concerts and Djs.

name: RSO.BERLIN
description: Griessmuehle moves southeast. From now, we are to be found with new beer garden and open-air area on the former Bärenquell brewery in Berlin-Niederschöneweide. Neither the closure of Griessmuehle, nor the numerous arduous removals and relocations could get us down. We are back—in the old manner, at a new location.

name: Säälchen
description: https://www.holzmarkt.com/saeaelchen

name: Scala
description: Club with showroom.

name: Silent Green
description:
Das silent green ist ein Veranstaltungsort und unabhängiges Projekt, das in den historischen Räumlichkeiten des ehemaligen Krematoriums Wedding eine in Berlin einzigartige Heimat gefunden hat.

In privater Trägerschaft versteht sich das 2013 gegründete Kulturquartier als geschützter Raum, in dem gedacht, geforscht und experimentiert werden kann. Im Mittelpunkt steht dabei ein formenübergreifendes Arbeiten: Grenzen einzelner künstlerischer Disziplinen sollen verschoben werden, um sie zu neuen, hybriden Formen zu verknüpfen.

Die Grundlage für ein solches Arbeiten bildet die einzigartige kreative Infrastruktur vor Ort, die sich neben der Programmarbeit des silent green Teams auch aus Kooperationen mit der Mieter*innengemeinschaft ergibt: In 13 Mieteinheiten führt der Kulturcampus auf 6000 qm rund 100 kreativ und kreativwirtschaftlich Tätige zusammen. Darunter sind mit Institutionen wie dem Musicboard Berlin, dem Label K7!, dem Harun Farocki Institut, dem transmediale e.V. sowie dem öffentlich zugänglichen Filmarchiv des Arsenal – Institut für Film und Videokunst e. V. wesentliche Berliner Akteure mit den Schwerpunkten Musik, Bewegtbild und Bildende Kunst versammelt.
Die hauseigene Gastronomie, das MARS | Küche & Bar ist das Herzstück des silent green; ein wenig verborgen im Seitenflügel des Gebäudes bietet es Ruhe vom Alltag und einen Ort des informellen Austauschs zwischen Mieter*innen, Publikum und Anwohner*innen.

Seit 2015 finden im historischen Gebäudeteil Tagungen, Konferenzen, Seminare und Workshops sowie besondere Feierlichkeiten statt. Zudem hat sich die Kuppelhalle als ein einmaliger Ort für Konzerte, Lesungen und Film etabliert. Im baulichen Kontrast dazu steht die 2019 fertiggestellte unterirdische Betonhalle. Auf einer Gesamtfäche von 1600qm ist es nun hier auch möglich, medienübergreifende Ausstellungen und Produktionen größeren Zuschnitts aus den Bereichen Film, Musik und Diskurs durchzuführen. Im Zusammenspiel von historischem Gebäudeteil und den neuen Bauten Betonhalle und dem Atelierhaus mit fünf weiteren multipel einsetzbaren Räumen, ist so ein großflächiger kreativer Campus entstanden.

Als freier Spielort und interdisziplinäre Produktionsstätte im Bereich Kunst und Kultur vermietet das silent green seine Veranstaltungsräume auch an Projekte Dritter. Auf diese Weise soll ein Ort der übergreifenden Begegnung und Partizipation entstehen, an dem sich Netzwerke und Kommunikationsräume zwischen Praxis und Theorie, Forschung und Anwendung, Produktion und Präsentation bilden können.

Unter dem Titel „Film Feld Forschung“ widmet sich das silent green in Zusammenarbeit mit der Co-Initiatorin Stefanie Schulte Strathaus den Formen und Rändern des dokumentarischen Erzählens. Entstehen soll ein Zentrum für Bewegtbildkunst – mit Ausstellungsprojekten, diskursiven und performativen Formaten. Das Musikprogramm im silent green hat sich keinem spezifischen Genre verschrieben. Stattdessen will es in seiner Diversität und seiner Vorliebe für neuartige Formate einen Zwischen-Ort öffnen, der einen Austausch und ein Experimentieren zwischen den Genres und seinem Publikum ermöglicht.

Das silent green ist unsere Herzensangelegenheit. Alle Einnahmen fließen daher direkt zurück in den Erhalt des Ortes und die Produktion künstlerischer und kultureller Projekte. Ziel ist, im Wedding eine nachhaltige kreative Infrastruktur aufzubauen, die fest in der Nachbarschaft verankert und zugleich kultureller Anziehungspunkt über Berlin hinaus in die Welt ist.

name: Sisyphos
description: Though a lesser-known member of Berlin's club scene, Sisyphos throws some of the city's most unhinged parties, often running from Friday to Monday with no break. It has a warehouse-style main room, usually with techno or tech house DJs playing, plus a more house-oriented second room and a large outdoor garden littered with abandoned cars and other debris. Lineups are almost never announced, but sometimes include big international DJs (Richie Hawtin played in 2015).

name: Solar
description:
Solar lounge, bar and restaurant is at the heart of Berlin - opposite Anhalter Bahnhof and Tempodrom, close to Potsdamer Platz and Brandenburger Tor.

Panorama windows on the 16th and 17th floors offer exclusive panoramic views of Berlin.

name: Spreehalle Berlin
description:
Along the River Spree at the turn of the twentieth century, AEG created transformers to transfer electrical energy from one circuit to another. Today, on the same industrial terrain in Oberschöneweide, the Spreehalle Berlin aims to transfer creative energy from mind to mind. Electrified by different media, global cultures, eras and genres, the Spreehalle strives to be a powerhouse for the exchange of music, performance, visual art and discourse.

The Spreehalle will flip the switch in September 2020, featuring a transmedia program led by the Marc Sinan Company. The new-music ensemble, founded in 2008 by guitarist and composer Marc Sinan (ECM Records), will welcome other internationally renowned artists to spark up inspiration like light bulbs above our heads. It's not about one vision, but many – a pluralism of perspectives from the performers and the audience members alike. The curated program, including the monthly Elektropolis concert series, will also create opportunity for critical dialogue and conversation.
Further distinguishing the venue is its custom-designed, 32-channel, 360° sound system: the Transformator. An instrument in itself, the Transformator allows an immersive experience where acoustics merge with architecture, audience with atmosphere, creating a space for communal listening.

name: Strandbad Plötzensee
description: Swimming lake in the city with sandy beach, naturist zone, play & sports areas, plus dining options.

name: Studio 26
description: New Club/Bar in 1920ies-New-York-vintage-style located in the Colbestraße (only few miles away from Warschauer Straße, RAW, Boxhagener Platz). 100qm offer enough space for 130 people.  It has a professional sound system and some professional light effects. The DJs play international Tech- und Melodic-House. The club has clean toilets and a cloakroom. The bar offers mondern long drinks and the usual non-alcoholic brands. The staff speaks german and englisch.

name: Studio183, Bikini Berlin
description: Pop by BIKINI Berlin to experience a unique mix of art and independent fashion.

name: Tante Grete
The Student Hotel Berlin
description: It is a vibrant place for co-living and co-working, where travelers, locals and students come together to learn, chill, work and party.

name: THF Radio / Torhaus
description:
THF Radio is a radio station located in the former gatehouse at Tempelhof Airport. An experimental space and mouthpiece for citizens, artists, musicians, creative people and initiatives. We are part of the TORHAUS at Tempelhof Airport. THF Radio is intended as an experimental forum: we want to address the airport and its history and give artists in the city a platform.

THF Radio ist die Radiostation im ehemaligen Pförtnerinnenhaus am Flughafen Tempelhof. Experimentierraum und Sprachrohr für Bürgerinnen, Künstlerinnen, Musiker*innen, Kreative und Initiativen. Wir sind Teil des TORHAUSES am Flughafen Tempelhof. THF Radio ist als experimentelles Forum gedacht: Wir wollen den Flughafen und seine Geschichte thematisieren und Künstler*innen in der Stadt eine Plattform geben.

address: Schlesische Straße 35 a, Kreuzberg Berlin, Germany
name: Transit Bar
Trauma Bar und Kino
description: New cultural space for dance, video art, cinematography and fashion

name: Tresor 31 Festival
description:
Tresor 31 Festival combines venues Tresor/Globus, Kraftwerk and OHM.

Selected events are hosted at multiple venues enabling guests to move freely between these different spaces, while other events will take place at one venue only.

name: Zenner
description: With the Zenner, a new cultural center for Berlin is being created in Treptower Park – directly on the River Spree. An international stage for musicians, artists, and creatives from around the world.
